module.name: project_management_resource_information
module.keywords: module, systems enginmeering, project management, management resource information

abstract.li: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation of the assignment of certification, classification, contract, timing, documentation, effectivity, justification and security data to product and activity data.

purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation of the assignment of certification, classification, contract, timing, documentation, effectivity, justification and security data to product and activity data.

The Project_management_resource_information_arm contains information entities that are used in many of the other arms. They are collected here as a resource for project management as a whole. They include items like time, classification, conditions, external sources, documents, effectivity, and validity.

It contains definition of a date according to the Gregorian calendar, definition of a point in time in a day, time offset from UTC, identification of a time interval, and representation of a relationship between two time intervals. It associates a time interval with product or activity data.
It contains the assignment of classification information to product or activity data.

It contains conditions specified by a textual description with a logical result, and supports use of external entities as input to a condition expression It contains condition assignment, and condition relationships.
It contains the identification of a document and the identification of a version of a document in both digital and physical forms. It contains document location and document relationships.

Both activities and products may be valid only for a period of time or in a particular context. This arm contains the identification of a domain of validity for other entities. This may be represented as an interval of serial numbers, an interval of time, or as a batch lot of product. It contains the definition of a relationship between two validity domains.

Often products, versions of product, line replaceable units, manufacturing procedures, or repair procedures are applicable only under specific conditions represented by effectivity. This arm contains effectivity and its application to product or activity data.
This arm contains the identification of external sources for a particular item or activity. It contains the association of an item to an external source where it can be provided.
purpose.note: Issue: Contract_arm, Document_assignment_arm, Justification_arm, and Security_classification_arm are redundant with arms in Work_structure_arm. Why should the same modules appear more than once in our module sets? Certification_arm, and Location_arm appear in Organization_structure_arm.
I have written the introduction without including the in scope statements of these redundant modules since they are described in the introduction to WS-arm and OS-arm.
